body_html:
Glad it's working!

Bazel outputs tensorflow_demo as an apk (Android application package), so it's actually already a fully functional app -- no need to do anything else with it at that point but install and run.

Assuming you have device connected with adb debugging enabled (run adb devices to check), you can install it via adb install -r bazel-bin/tensorflow/examples/android/tensorflow_demo.apk.

You can find the adb tool under your SDK/platform-tools directory.

bazel mobile-install -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo --start_app will also build, install, and start the app in a single command, which you may find more convenient.

Assuming you have device connected with adb debugging enabled (run adb devices to check), you can install it via adb install -r bazel-bin/tensorflow/examples/android/tensorflow_demo.apk.
You can find the adb tool under your SDK/platform-tools directory.
bazel mobile-install -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo --start_app will also build, install, and start the app in a single command, which you may find more convenient.
body:
Glad it's working!

Bazel outputs tensorflow_demo as an apk (Android application package), so it's actually already a fully functional app -- no need to do anything else with it at that point but install and run.

Assuming you have device connected with adb debugging enabled (run `adb devices` to check), you can install it via `adb install -r bazel-bin/tensorflow/examples/android/tensorflow_demo.apk`.

You can find the adb tool under your SDK/platform-tools directory.

`bazel mobile-install -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo --start_app` will also build, install, and start the app in a single command, which you may find more convenient.
